intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. obtusulum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are upright and often slightly hairy. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade.
